name: sfchronicle
text:
S.F. General Hospital vaccinated the city’s first handful of people against the coronavirus yesterday.

The historic day opened up numerous questions: How does the vaccine work? Who will get it first? What are the side effects?

Listen  🎧:
https://t.co/ltg8Jad1fP

name: sfchronicle
text:
The Trump administration said it would withhold $200 million in federal health care funding from California for requiring that insurance providers in the state cover abortion services.
https://t.co/JxUe92ueIq

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @akoseff: "Whatever one thinks of the legality of abortion, no one should be punished for declining to pay for or assist in the taking of human life," said Roger Severino, director of the Office at Civil Rights at the Department of Health and Human Services. https://t.co/9WqBY5ujVH

name: sfchronicle
text: The state added 21,200 people in the year ending July 1, 2020, a growth rate of 0.05%. https://t.co/WAKxaknmVJ

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @SFChronicleFood: After nearly a decade, Mission Chinese — a Valencia Street restaurant that celebrated small, artisan cheesemakers — is closing at the end of the year https://t.co/Uh66bntVoa

name: sfchronicle
text:
Mission Cheese, one of the few restaurants in the country to create a menu around American artisan cheese, is closing at the end of the year.
https://t.co/Cg9eNnF4oB

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @Con_Chron: Wiseman and Green won't play tomorrow in the preseason finale vs. Sacramento. name: sfchronicle
text: RT @SportingGreenSF: Alex Smith’s extraordinary journey — from severe injury, possible death, probable amputation, grueling and lengthy rehabilitation to a return as a starting quarterback — is becoming the stuff of NFL lore. But he’s not the only survivor, writes @AnnKillion  https://t.co/XlHzepSzhg

name: sfchronicle
text:
Contra Costa County reported a record-high 1,010 new coronavirus infections and 11 deaths on Wednesday, health department data show. 

San Francisco also broke its daily case record, reporting 335 new cases on Wednesday. https://t.co/k6jOKyg9AR

name: sfchronicle
text:
When will our lives return to normal? Here is what we know so far.
https://t.co/Xjvtf3EFHx

name: sfchronicle
text:
Clifton Hall Dormitory in Rockridge, a vacant 63-unit building in Oakland, will be transformed into housing for homeless families and seniors.
https://t.co/sfT4Bo2IT2

name: sfchronicle
text:
RT @SFChronicleFood: Napa Valley wineries will have to close their tasting rooms starting Thursday, joining wineries in Sonoma and other Bay Area counties that have already been forced to close in recent weeks.
https://t.co/Opk002F9gj

name: sfchronicle
text:
RT @SFC_Datebook: Here’s a list of Bay Area in-person and virtual visits with Santa, making sure the holiday spirit endures through 2020. 🎅🌟🎄

via @yoshi140 
https://t.co/v3tjQoeSKh

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @SportingGreenSF: The Mavericks recently had a historic day for big-wave surfing, with ultimate conditions and a cast of elite riders enjoying a full day of perfection, writes @Bruce_Jenkins1  https://t.co/rC0a50yQZX

name: sfchronicle
text:
RT @MusicSF: The availability of Bay Area intensive care unit beds dropped to 12.9% on Tuesday, triggering California’s strict stay-at-home orders for all counties in the region.  @sfchronicle 

https://t.co/WPMhRoMRYy

name: sfchronicle
text:
RT @Esther_mobley: They're closed! They're open! Some of them are closed! They're partially re-open! 

After months of flip flops, the fate of Bay Area winery tasting rooms is now clear, at least for the remainder of 2020: they must close.
https://t.co/fiWLaOTRtZ

name: sfchronicle
text: Amazon is asking the federal government to categorize its workers a essential in the priority list to receive the coronavirus vaccine — including its warehouse, grocery store and data center staff —according to a letter seen by Reuters. https://t.co/wX6fQ3BYum

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @SFChronicleFood: Find dishes like duck confit salad on Dutch crunch at this brand-new East Bay restaurant. https://t.co/bMa6GVOTaQ

name: sfchronicle
text:
A coyote bit a grocery store worker in the leg last night, yet another extremely rare human attack in an East Bay community.
https://t.co/oNy9EWtmdV

name: sfchronicle
text: San Mateo County’s Board of Supervisors president, Warren Slocum, on Wednesday urged residents to stay home for the holidays as the county fell under California’s regional stay-home order. https://t.co/6vpSVIyq3t
